d:entry.p: 3rd conj. verb (perf. inf. cecinisse, sup. cantum)

ol.li: to sing, sing of : Arma virumque cano — Arms and a man I sing.
(in war) to sound (the signal) : signum (receptui) canere — to sound the signal (for retreat).
(with abl.) to play (an instrument) : tibia canere — to play the flute.

d:entry.d:title: homō
d:entry.p: masc. or fem. 3rd decl. noun (gen. hominis)

ol.li: man (as opposed to an animal), a human being, a person

d:entry.p: ORIGIN French, from thé 'tea', based on Chinese 茶 (chá) 'tea'

ol.li: a man (as opposed to a woman).
(with doub. acc.) to name, designate : eum amicum voco — I call him a friend.
to bring or put into a state or condition : vocare in dubium — to call into question.
